description: From international scientific vocabulary, from French arachnide (1809, Lamarck), from New Latin, from Ancient Greek ἀράχνη (arákhnē, “spider”) with the suffix -id; surface analysis, arachn- +‎ -id.

entries.meaning: Any of the eight-legged creatures, including spiders, mites, and scorpions, of the class Arachnida.
